title: subHeader
value: Tone is the inflection of your brand voice. Depending on the situation, your tone may change.

title: p1
value: Say something about the theme for each issue.

title: p2
value: Our tone is frank, XXXX and at times whimsical with a degree of very specific focused attention on fine details that the reader can then vicariously experience. All texts including interviews should transmit a strong sense of geographical place, whether past or present, with essays / excursions using lots of imagery to convey how a place looks, feels, smells, sounds etc. As important as the physical elements of any location is its psychological aspect, a place being nothing without the people which inhabit or perceive it.

title: p3
value: Essays should always be well researched and written in third person, objective voice that is not too opinion-heavy. However, pitches for essays can be inspired by themes that you have a personal attachment to or interest in.

title: p4
value: Essays should be less conceptual or comparative and more targeted on a specific object, thing or person; a mono-thematic viewpoint.

title: Example of specific details:
value: a painter’s mono-thematic repetition of a specific emblem which has the most noticeable effect on the subject.

How an artist elevates a certain banal object or concept and its relationship to people could be an essay about a park in which specific feature such as a tree or bandstand communicates something greater than itself. Or you may wish to write about a character in a book or film who is inseparable from or defines the overall narrative.

Interview ideas or questions might be inspired by a particular methodology or style that characterises the work or personality of a person. Importantly, the thing or person you chose to write about should communicate something about the place in which they exist or originate from.
How a director has a very particular perception of something and uses it to express a time or place and its relationship to people.

title: e1
value: For example, if you’re giving something away you might have a fun, light-hearted tone.

title: e2
value: However, if you’re addressing the fact that your system is down, you would take a more serious tone.
